algorithm_technique: Gray code generation using XOR and bit shifts
problem_summary_simple: Generate a circular permutation of binary numbers where adjacent numbers differ by one bit, starting with a given number.
problem_summary_technical: Constructs a Gray code sequence by XORing the start value with a sequence derived from bit shifts, ensuring adjacent elements differ by one bit.
key_insights: The problem is equivalent to generating a Gray code sequence.
The formula `start ^ (i >> 1) ^ i` cleverly generates the Gray code sequence relative to the start value.
The XOR operation is key to flipping a single bit at a time.
